resources.string: Do you want save the board?

Sudoku is a game typically played in a 9x9 grid that has been divided into 9 3x3 grids. The goal is to fill all the grids with a number between 1\-9 without repeating any of the numbers horizontally, vertically og in the same 3x3 grid.

To put an answer in a tile, tap the cell you want to answer, then press one of the numbered buttons below to select the answer you want to input. You cannot change a number that come pre filled when playing a created board. Select the same number to again to erase if you regret.
In case you are unsure what the answer is, you can hold the cell to enter thinking mode. This allows you to mark every possible answer you think the cell can hold for easier deduction.
By pressing the "create new board" button, you can create your own custom board. By selecting a grid, you can create the "hints" that will be saved. You cannot win the board in "creator mode"

To save the board, you have to complete it in "player mode". To toggle between "creator mode" and "player mode", press the "creator/player mode" button on top of the screen. Once the board is completed you get the option to save it, go back to editing it or quitting the board. Saved boards can be loaded when playing existing boards
